content:
Check:
  all:
    - any:
        - name: --STAT
          operator: empty
        - name: --DRVFL
          operator: not_equal_to
          value: Y
    - all:
        - name: --ORRES
          operator: empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000200
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Verify that --ORRES is not missing when either --STAT is null or --DRVFL
  not equal to 'Y'
Outcome:
  Message: --ORRES cannot be null when --STAT is null or --DRVFL not equal to 'Y'
  Output Variables:
    - --STAT
    - --DRVFL
    - --ORRES
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Value
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0348
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: "--ORRES variable contains the result of the measurement\
                  \ or finding as originally received or collected.  --ORRES is an\
                  \ expected variable and should always be populated, with two exceptions':'\
                  \ When --STAT = \"NOT DONE\" since there is no result for such a\
                  \ record When --DRVFL = \"Y\" since the distinction between an original\
                  \ result and a standard result is not applicable for records for\
                  \ which --DRVFL = \"Y\" "
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: '    '
                Section: 4.5.1.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Verify that --ORRES is not missing when either --STAT is null or --DRVFL not equal to 'Y'

Outcome.Message: --ORRES cannot be null when --STAT is null or --DRVFL not equal to 'Y'

Citations.Cited_Guidance: --ORRES variable contains the result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.  --ORRES is an expected variable and should always be populated, with two exceptions':' When --STAT = "NOT DONE" since there is no result for such a record When --DRVFL = "Y" since the distinction between an original result and a standard result is not applicable for records for which --DRVFL = "Y"
